title: Netflix probably isn’t streaming 4K on your PC — here’s how to fix that
content:
If you’re reading this post, you’re probably a person who appreciates image quality. You buy the best screen you can afford. You keep your display settings reasonably calibrated. You optimize your viewing distance for maximum detail perception. Naturally, you also pay for Netflix‘s top-tier 4K plan. Life’s too short for 1080p. One night, it’s too late to turn on your 100-inch TV, so you start up Netflix on your PC, eager to appreciate all 8 million pixels of glorious 4K resolution. Except something seems off. Why can’t you see every pore on Danny LaRusso’s face in Cobra Kai?  I’m sorry…

This story continues at The Next Web

Or just read more coverage about: Netflix
description: If you watch Netflix on your PC, there's a good chance you're not watching it in 4K — even if you're paying for it. Here's how to fix that.
